name: Holiday Inn NYC - Lower East Side

reviews.text: We had a great stay near the Lower East Side Tenement museum with good dining and walking to nearby sights. Desk Staff were especially friendly and the facilities were new and clean and very comfortable. Very good value compared to nearby hotels. Would highly recommend and would come back here again!
reviews.title: Great location and value, new facility

reviews.text: A very friendly and pleasant hotel. Staff were courteous and greeted you with a smile every time we saw them. Situated in a perfect spot as I wished to explore LES, East Village and Williamsburg. Some very good cheap bars and restaurants around this area including The Meatball Shop and Katz's Deli just 2 or 3 blocks away.
reviews.title: Just What We Wanted.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After all this a Holiday Inn and not The Ritz and you get exactly what you pay for. If you have seen all of the touristy stuff in NYC then I would wholeheartedly recommend this place as a base to explore the rest and best NYC has to offer. Subway is 2 mins walk and Williamsburg Bridge on the doorstep for a lovely walk across to Brooklyn.
reviews.title: Pleasant surprise

reviews.text: Can't fault it and didn't try to.
reviews.title: Early Apr 2013 3-day visit to Holiday Inn Lower East Side

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a brand new hotel in a location close to Williamsburg bridge and close to the Lower East Side bar district. I made the wrong reservations and ended up here accidentally. I originally wanted the one in SoHo. But luckily, every Holiday Inn is about the same. The room is great and we slept well. Even though it is on a busy street, we slept like a baby. What I liked about this hotel is that it is close to a lot of great restaurants and bars ranging from high end to cheap eats. Since we drove to NYC this time, parking right across the street was very convenient and about $10 cheaper than most other parking garages. Service was great. My room didn't come with breakfast but I was given complimentary breakfast coupons that I couldn't use because I slept in past 10.
reviews.title: Adequate for a quick weekend...

reviews.text: As regular visitors to New York's Lower East Side we had been eagerly awaiting the opening of this hotel on the corner of Delancey and Suffolk Street. Now back home after a 4 night stay and whilst generally pleased with most of the hotel's facilities there are perhaps some teething problems that do need to be resolved.
reviews.title: Open At Last!

reviews.text: Arriving last Sunday afternoon, the hotel reception staff were happy to give us a room on the 6th floor overlooking Suffolk Street rather than the lower floor room that we had been allocated facing onto Delancey and the noise of the traffic going onto and off the Williamsburg Bridge.
reviews.title: Great Stay
Great customer service
reviews.text: Our king size room was adequate and surprisingly large for a New York hotel. Lots of interesting connections and technology underneath the large screen TV.
A comfortable bed and a good sized shower though little storage space in the room - but, hey, after all this is New York isn't it?
reviews.title: Received a full refund after an emergency cancellation

reviews.text: So what wasn't so good? Two evenings out of the four we were in the hotel we came back to the room to find that when the room had been serviced earlier in the day but neither used coffee sachets nor paper cups had been replaced. Once is unfortunate but 50% of the times we were there?
reviews.title: Nice Hotel on the city !

description: Beautiful hotel is located in New York (East Village - Lower East Side), close to Lower East Side Tenement Museum, Brooklyn Bridge, and New York University. Also nearby are Federal Reserve Bank of New York and World Trade Center - Ground Zero.
